content: double_crochet + ch1 to get to the next starting piece you re going to do a dc3tog skip next st yo insert hook in next st and pull up a loop yo insert hook into join on previous row pull up a loop yo skip next st insert hook in next st and pull up a loop you should have 4 loops on your hook yo and pull through all 4 loops continue with the pattern of skip next st ch1 double_crochet double_crochet ch2 double_crochet in corners and decrease in inner angles skipping a st in between end the row with a decrease in 3rd from last st and last st skipping a st in between turn work and ch2 crochetghoulie tumblr com nostromo 7 row 8 right side double_crochet in first ch1 space and in each double_crochet across like row 6 2dc ch2 2dc in corners and decrease in inner angles skipping a st in between once you get to the top points of the starting pieces you ll add in a bobble circle of the previous color like rounds 4 and 6 once you get to the bottom point you ll make a decrease in the dcs on either side of the dc3tog of previous row pic 1 continue making a double_crochet in each double_crochet and ch1sp and decrease in inner angle when you get to the next corner make 2dc and ch1 into it loosen the loop and remove the hook insert your hook from right to left in the ch2 space of the matching corner on the previous starting piece place loop on your hook pic 2 pull the loop through the ch2 space ch1 and 2dc in the corner you were working on continue with the pattern of double_crochet in each double_crochet and ch1 space decrease in inner angles and 2dc ch2 2dc in each corner make sure to join the lowest corners together between the starting pieces to end row decrease in second to last st and last st turn repeat row 7 and 8 for pattern for each repeat of row 8 you ll need to make bobble circles in the previous color for each starting piece you made this gives the illusion of the colors blending together happy hooking feel free to contact me via ravelry or my
